EnablingAuthority.XRefExternal: ENVIRONMENTAL VIOLATIONS ADMINISTRATIVE MONETARY PENALTIES ACT

Identification.LongTitle: Environmental Violations Administrative Monetary Penalties Regulations

Provision.Text: His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of the Environment, pursuant to section 5a of the Environmental Violations Administrative Monetary Penalties Actb, makes the annexed Environmental Violations Administrative Monetary Penalties Regulations.

Section.Text: In these Regulations, Act means the Environmental Violations Administrative Monetary Penalties Act, unless otherwise indicated.

Section.MarginalNote: Provisions of Environmental Acts and regulations

Subsection.Text: The contravention of a provision of an Environmental Act or of any of its regulations that is set out in column 1 of Schedule 1 is designated as a violation that may be proceeded with in accordance with the Act.

The contravention of any order or direction made under a provision of an Environmental Act or of any of its regulations that is set out in column 1 of Schedule 2 is designated as a violation that may be proceeded with in accordance with the Act.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Conditions of permit, licence or authorization
Subsection.Text: The failure to comply with a condition of a permit, licence or other authorization issued under an Environmental Act or any of its regulations that is referred to in a provision set out in column 1 of Schedule 3 is designated as a violation that may be proceeded with in accordance with the Act.

Section.Text: The contravention of a provision set out in column 1 of Schedule 1, of an order or direction made under a provision set out in column 1 of Schedule 2, or of a condition referred to in a provision set out in column 1 of Schedule 3 is classified as a Type A, B or C violation in accordance with column 2 of the respective schedule.
The amount of the penalty for each violation is to be determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the baseline penalty amount determined under section 5;
is the history of non-compliance amount, if any, as determined under section 6;
is the environmental harm amount, if any, as determined under section 7; and
is the economic gain amount, if any, as determined under section 8.

Section.Text: The baseline penalty amount for a violation is the amount set out in column 3 of Schedule 4 that corresponds to the category of the violator and the type of violation committed as set out in columns 1 and 2, respectively, of that Schedule.

Subsection.Text: If the violator has a history of non-compliance, the history of non-compliance amount is the amount set out in column 4 of Schedule 4 that corresponds to the category of the violator and the type of violation committed as set out in columns 1 and 2, respectively, of that Schedule.
A violator has a history of non-compliance if, in the five years preceding

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the commission of a violation relating to any Division of Part 7 of the Canadian Environmental Protection Act, 1999 or any regulation made under that Division, they were subject to an enforcement action in relation to that Division or any of those regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the commission of a violation relating to Part 9 of the Canadian Environmental Protection Act, 1999 or any regulation made under that Part, they were subject to an enforcement action in relation to that Part or any of those regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the commission of a violation relating to any Environmental Act, other than the Canadian Environmental Protection Act, 1999, or a regulation made under one of those Acts, they were subject to an enforcement action in relation to that Act or any of that Act’s regulations.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection (2), enforcement action means the imposition of a ticket, penalty, conviction or injunction or the use of environmental protection alternative measures.

Section.Text: If the violation has resulted in harm to the environment, the environmental harm amount is the amount set out in column 5 of Schedule 4 that corresponds to the category of the violator and the type of violation committed as set out in columns 1 and 2, respectively, of that Schedule.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), if the violation has resulted in economic gain to the violator, including an avoided financial cost, the economic gain amount is the amount set out in column 6 of Schedule 4 that corresponds to the category of the violator and the type of violation committed as set out in columns 1 and 2, respectively, of that Schedule.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Only gain avoidance of cost of authorization
Subsection.Text: If the only economic gain is the avoidance of the cost of obtaining a permit, licence or other authorization, the economic gain amount is the amount set out in column 7 of Schedule 4 that corresponds to the category of the violator and the type of violation committed as set out in columns 1 and 2, respectively, of that Schedule.
A notice of violation referred to in section 10 of the Act is to be served

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an individual,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: by leaving a copy of it with the individual at any place or with someone who appears to be an adult member of the same household at the individual’s last known address or usual place of residence or, in the case of an individual under the age of 18, with a parent or other person having custody of them or exercising parental authority over them, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: by sending a copy of it by registered mail, courier, fax or other electronic means to the recipient’s last known address or usual place of residence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a person other than an individual,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: by leaving a copy of it with their authorized representative or with an officer or other individual who appears to direct or control the person’s head office or place of business or that of their authorized representative,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: by sending a copy of it by registered mail, courier or fax to the person’s authorized representative or to the person’s head office or place of business or that of their authorized representative, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: by sending a copy of it by electronic means to an individual referred to in subparagraph (i); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a ship or vessel,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: by delivering a copy of it personally to the master or another individual who is, or appears to be, in charge of the ship or vessel,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: by affixing a copy of it to the ship or vessel in a manner than ensures that it is prominently in view,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: by leaving a copy of it with the authorized representative of the owner or operator of the ship or vessel or with an officer or other individual who appears to direct or control the owner, operator or authorized representative’s head office or place of business,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: by sending a copy of it by registered mail, courier or fax to the owner or operator of the ship or vessel, or to the authorized representative, head office or place of business of that owner or operator, or

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: by sending a copy of it by electronic means to an individual referred to in subparagraph (i), (iii) or (iv).

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an acknowledgement of service signed by or on behalf of the person or ship or vessel served, specifying the date and location of service;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a certificate of service, in a form approved by the Minister and signed by the person who effected the service, stating that service was made on the person or ship or vessel named in the certificate and indicating the means by which and day on which service was effected; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a record of electronic transmission setting out the date and time of transmission.

Subsection.Text: In the absence of an acknowledgement of service or a certificate of service, service is considered effective,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of service by registered mail or courier, on the 10th day after the day on which the notice is sent, as indicated on the receipt issued by the postal or courier service; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of service by fax or other electronic means, on the day on which it is sent, as indicated on the record of transmission.

Section.MarginalNote: On behalf of ship or vessel
Section.Text: For the purpose of section 15 of the Act, a review may be requested on behalf of a ship or vessel by

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an authorized representative of its owner or operator.

Section.Text: These Regulations come into force on the day on which they are registered.

ScheduleFormHeading.TitleText: Violations — Conditions of Permit, Licence or Authorization

row.entry: 129(1) — conditions other than those described in paragraphs (a) to (g)
Other person or ship or vessel
